alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:19PM EDT until June 23 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Durham and Orange. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Carrboro, Butner, Eno River State Park, Efland, Cane Creek Reservoir, Jordan Lake, Saxapahaw, Gorman, Sutphin and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
